diagnosis.symptomsAtPresentation: Mild urinary frequency, nocturia x2. Found on screening PSA/DRE.

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) with Androgen Deprivation Therapy (ADT)
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing Prostate gland + proximal Seminal Vesicles (PTV_ProstateSV).
treatmentPlan.detailedConcurrentChemo: Leuprolide injection (e.g., 6-month depot) - Started 2 months prior to RT, planned for long-term (1.5-2 years).
medications: ADT side effect management (hot flashes, etc.)
Bowel/bladder symptom management during RT (e.g., Loperamide PRN, encourage hydration)

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in VacLok bag with ankle immobilization. Full bladder / empty rectum protocol followed. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV and/or rectal contrast may be used per institutional protocol but not specified here.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired with full bladder/empty rectum protocol followed. Fiducials visualized. Scan fused with diagnostic MRI for VMAT planning.

dosimetry.constraints: Rectum V70Gy < 20%; Bladder V75Gy < 15%; Fem Head Max < 50 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Definitive VMAT with ADT. Daily IGRT to fiducial markers is required.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT match to fiducial markers. Shifts applied as needed. Good bladder/rectum filling today.
fractions.sideEffects: Mild increase in urinary frequency noted.
fractions.notes: Patient managing ADT side effects (mild hot flashes). Continue to review bowel/bladder management.

imagingAndReports.summary: Confirms T2c disease, capsule bulging bilaterally, no definite ECE. Seminal vesicles appear clear.
No evidence of osseous metastatic disease.
Placement of 3 gold fiducial markers in prostate under TRUS guidance.
CT acquired with full bladder/empty rectum protocol. Fiducials visualized.

labResults.notes: Confirms castration level achieved with ADT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Charles Brown (Urology)
progressNotes.summary: Pt referred for elevated PSA. Biopsy confirms Gleason 7 (4+3) AdenoCa. Staging T2c N0 M0. Discussed treatment options (Surgery vs RT+ADT). Given age/risk group, pt prefers RT+ADT. Plan to start Leuprolide injection, place fiducials, refer to Rad Onc.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Maria Garcia (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ favorable high-risk prostate ca, started on ADT. Plan for definitive EBRT via VMAT to prostate/SVs to 79.2Gy/44fx. Discussed procedure, fiducials/IGRT, bowel/bladder prep, potential side effects (GU/GI toxicity acute & late, ED risk, fatigue). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled after fiducial placement.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Charles Brown (Urology)
progressNotes.summary: Successful placement of 3 gold fiducial markers into prostate via TRUS guidance. No complications.

progressNotes.author: Physics/Dosimetry
progressNotes.summary: VMAT plan completed, meets dose constraints for rectum, bladder, femoral heads. Plan approved by Dr. Garcia. Ready for treatment start.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Maria Garcia (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 10/44 fx. Reports mild increase in urinary frequency, minimal rectal discomfort. Tolerating ADT side effects (mild hot flashes). Setup/IGRT consistent. Continue RT. Review bowel/bladder management.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Definitive (curative) treatment of high-risk prostate cancer.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: GU symptoms (frequency, urgency, burning), GI symptoms (diarrhea, rectal irritation), fatigue. Late: Risk of chronic GU/GI issues, erectile dysfunction, low risk of secondary malignancy. ADT side effects (hot flashes, fatigue, loss of libido).
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of daily bladder/rectum prep for setup accuracy. Reporting significant changes in urinary or bowel habits.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT, follow bladder/rectum prep instructions, report side effects.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Continue ADT as scheduled with Urology. Use Tamsulosin as needed for urinary symptoms.

cptCharges.description: Placement of interstitial device(s) for radiation therapy guidance (e.g., fiducial markers), prostate
Image Guided RT (IGRT - CBCT/kV for fiducials)
